@rhtyd @DaanHoogland I have refactored the createAsync method in StorageSystemDataMotionStrategy.java. I still need to make use of the ConfigKey class instead of the Config class, as Daan requested. I should be able to do this tomorrow (well, technically, later today).

@mike-tutkowski @rafaelweingartner the questions are:
Are we comfortable with this code as is?
Do we want to go with it in 4.11?
How much effort do we put in after releasing this?
I can not fully assess this as it is so big. And the argument of cyclic complexity of both methods and classes is weighing heavily.

btw @mike-tutkowski I'll stop bugging you about the noisy whitelines but I will remove a lot of them at my next chance ;)

@DaanHoogland comfortable I am not. However, this is an interesting feature; and I understand how hard it is to create and maintain something like (conflict may happen...). If everything is working and tests passing, I would be ok with it.

One thing we must keep in mind though. We need to start looking for better code (code for people). I know that it was like this before and @mike-tutkowski is only working on top of it.
